availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Corydon Sackett Abell (Harrodsburg, Kentucky, physician, Mercer Co Court clerk, State Rep)

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, physician and politician. New York native. Son of Russell Abel and Thankful Hunter Abel. Married to Mary Lock Moore Abell. Father of Mary M. Abell and Thomas Russell Abell. Assistant surgeon in the 3rd Regular U.S. Dragoons during the Mexican-American War from April 1847 to July 1848. Physician in Harrodsburg in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Harrodsburg in 1850. Physician in Harrodsburg in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Mercer County, Kentucky, from 1859 to 1861. Declined a commission as captain in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) in July 1861. Clerk of the Mercer County Court from 1862 to 1864.
